intro: Coreopsis poloe, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for gardens and natural landscapes. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to native plant collections.
